title: Breaking Free trailer: Sridhar Rangayan’s LGBT documentary against Section 377
text:
Breaking Free trailer: Sridhar Rangayan’s LGBT documentary against Section 377 By Shweta Parande on October 9, 2015 at 11:41 AM Comments 
Filmmaker Sridhar Rangayan ‘s documentary Breaking Free premiered at the Kashish Mumbai International Queer Film Festival in Mumbai in May 2015 to applause. The film was also screened at Films Division on Peddar Road in Mumbai on August 1. Rangayan’s film shows how the imposition of the controversial Section 377 of the Indian Penal Code has affected the lives of the people belonging to the lesbian, gay, bisexual, transgender, queer and hijra (LGBTQH ) community. Breaking Free will be screened again in Mumbai on October 9, 2015, as part of the discussion on the topic at the Godrej Culture Lab in Vikhroli, Mumbai. 
Along with people of the LGBTQ community who are speaking out and have suffered at the hands of the police due to section 377, Breaking Free features activists Manohar Elavarthi, Sumathi Murthy and Vinay Chandran, lawyers B T Venkatesh, Arvind Narrain and Danish Sheikh. (ALSO SEE: Marathi LGBT Short Film to Compete at International Iris Prize Festival ) 
What Section 377 (Unnatural offences) entails: “Whoever voluntarily has carnal intercourse against the order of nature with any man, woman or animal, shall be punished with imprisonment for life, or with imprisonment of either description for term which may extend to ten years, and shall also be liable to fine.” 
Breaking Free is produced by Solaris Pictures. Watch trailer here.
